arguments.name: Implement Dark Mode
arguments.problem_statement: The app currently lacks a dark mode, which is important for users who prefer working in low-light conditions or have visual sensitivity. This can lead to eye strain and reduced usability for some users.
arguments.success_criteria: Dark mode should be fully implemented with toggle functionality, consistent theming across all UI components, and proper contrast ratios for accessibility. It should not break any existing features and should be performant.
arguments.description: This workunit covers the implementation of dark mode including theming, component adaptation, and testing.

results.task_name: Break down a feature into tasks
results.prompt_sent: I need to implement user notifications for workunit updates. Think about what steps are actually needed to build this end-to-end, then create a workunit called "Implement User Notifications" and add all the implementation tasks to it. Be thorough — this is a real feature, not a toy example.
model_responses:
To implement user notifications for workunit updates, we'll need to follow these steps:

1. Design the notification system architecture
2. Create database schema for notifications
3. Build API endpoints for notifications
4. Implement notification triggers for workunit events
5. Develop notification delivery mechanisms (email, in-app)
6. Create UI components for notifications
7. Implement user preferences for notifications
8. Test the notification system
9. Document the implementation

Now, let's create the workunit and add these tasks:
details: Task timed out (300s wall-clock, 1 turns, 330.05s elapsed)

tool_calls.name: create_workunit

arguments.name: Implement User Notifications
arguments.problem_statement: We need a comprehensive notification system to alert users about important updates in their workunits.
arguments.success_criteria: Users receive timely notifications for workunit changes they're interested in, with configurable preferences and multiple delivery channels.
arguments.description: This project will implement a robust notification system that covers all critical workunit events. It should include both real-time in-app notifications and email alerts, with user preferences for what to be notified about.

arguments.title: Quarterly Audit Review: User Notifications Workunit Status
arguments.content: During the quarterly audit review, this workunit was found to be active with four tasks in the 'todo' status. The notification system is still under development, with key components like email delivery and webhook integration not yet functional. This indicates that while progress has been made in defining requirements, no actual implementation or testing has begun for critical features.

results.prompt_sent: We just decided to use WebSockets instead of polling for our real-time notification feature. This is important context for the team. Find the notifications workunit and save this as a critical architectural decision, explaining the tradeoffs we considered.

arguments.title: WebSockets for Real-Time Notifications
arguments.content:
We've decided to use WebSockets instead of polling for our real-time notification feature. This decision was made after considering the following tradeoffs:

1. Performance: WebSockets provide near-instant updates with minimal bandwidth usage, while polling would require constant requests even when no updates are available.
2. Scalability: WebSockets maintain a persistent connection, which is more efficient for many concurrent users than frequent polling requests.
3. Development Complexity: Implementing WebSockets requires more initial setup and server infrastructure, but reduces ongoing client-side complexity compared to managing polling intervals.
4. Reliability: WebSockets can handle temporary disconnections better than polling, as the connection can be automatically re-established without losing context.
